net.sf.jclal.util.learningcurve

Class LearningCurveUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclal.util.learningcurve.LearningCurveUtility

  • public class LearningCurveUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for extracting information from the learning curves.
    Author:
    Oscar Gabriel Reyes Pupo, Eduardo Perez Perdomo

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        args - The command line arguments Case 1: -csvAULC -- If is selected then -inputDirectory String : input directory which contains the reports -measure String : measure to analyze [-outputDirectory] String : output directory [-min] false (default)|true : indicates whether the measure is minimal or maximal Case 2: -pageTest -- If is selected then -inputDirectory String : input directory which contains the reports -measure String : measure to analyze [-min] false (default)|true : indicates whether the measure is minimal or maximal [-outputDirectory] String : output directory Case 3: -reportsRange -- If is selected then -inputDirectory [String] : input directory which contains the reports [-outputDirectory] String : output directory -ranges "range1 range2": the ranges to analyze (can be more than one), e.g. '34-56' 'first-45' '34-last'; Case 4: -csvForGraphic -- If is selected then -inputDirectory [String] : input directory which contains the reports [-outputDirectory] String : output directory -measure String : measure to analyze
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Launch an exception in case that a error occurs
        java.io.IOException - Launch an exception in case that a error occurs
        java.lang.Exception

      • csvAULCFileReports

        public static java.io.File csvAULCFileReports(java.lang.String inputDirectory,
                                              java.lang.String measure,
                                              java.lang.String outputDirectory,
                                              java.lang.String min)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        It allows to construct a CSV file with the experimental results on several datasets. An input directory with the experimental results organized for each dataset is needed. It also can create the corresponding files with latex tables.
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - The input directory which contain the experimental results for each dataset
        measure - The measure to analyze
        outputDirectory - The output directory (optional)
        min - Indicate if the evaluation measure is minimal or maximal
        Returns:
        The file created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IO exception is launched if an error occur.

      • pageTrendTest

        public static java.io.File pageTrendTest(java.lang.String inputDirectory,
                                         java.lang.String measure,
                                         java.lang.String min,
                                         java.lang.String outputDirectory)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.lang.Exception
        Execute the Page trend 's test. For each pair of strategy a file with the average rankings is created.
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - The directory which contains the experimental results. The experimental results must be organized for each dataset.
        measure - The measure to analyze
        outputDirectory - The outputDirectory (optional)
        min - Flag that indicates if the measure is minimal or maximal
        Returns:
        The output directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IO exception is launched if an error occur.
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is launched if an error occur.

      • reportsRange

        public static java.io.File reportsRange(java.lang.String inputDirectory,
                                        java.lang.String outputDirectory,
                                        java.util.ArrayList<LearningCurveUtility.Range> rangesSeveral)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        It modifies a set of reports leaving only the iterations of the interest for the researcher
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - Directory with a set of reports
        outputDirectory - The output directory (optional)
        rangesSeveral - The ranges to analyze.
        Returns:
        The output directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IOException is launched if an error occur.

        Create the table in latex format

      • createSingleCSVForGraphic

        public static java.io.File createSingleCSVForGraphic(java.lang.String inputDirectory,
                                                     java.lang.String measureName,
                                                     java.lang.String outputDirectory)
        Create a single CSV file which contains pairs (x=number of labeled instances,y=measure value) for each report file contained in the source directory. These CSV files can after be used for plotting with GNUPlot.
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - The directory which contains the reports
        measureName - The measure to use.
        outputDirectory - The output directory. By default, it is created a directory with the same name as the input directory and a consecutive number.
        Returns:
        The CSV file

      • getAreaUnderLearningCurve

        public static double getAreaUnderLearningCurve(double[] ds,
                                               double xDelta)
        Calculates the area under the learning curve (ALC).
        Parameters:
        ds - an array of values
        xDelta - The step
        Returns:
        The area under learning curve
